articles.description: Chelsea boss Emma Hayes is named the new manager of the United States women's national team and will take charge when the Women's Super League season ends in May.
articles.title: US women's team confirm Hayes as new head coach

articles.description: A man is held in connection with the death of Nottingham Panthers player Adam Johnson.
articles.title: Adam Johnson: Manslaughter arrest over ice hockey player's death

articles.description: Video assistant referees are asked to be more proactive in challenging officials following a series of controversial decisions.
articles.title: VAR must challenge on-field referees more - Webb

articles.description: India are overwhelming favourites for their World Cup semi-final against New Zealand, but arrive with the weight of history on their shoulders.
articles.title: 'It feels like only the weight of history can stop India'

articles.description: Barcelona start the defence of their Champions League crown with a comfortable victory against Benfica.
articles.title: Barcelona begin European defence with one-sided win

articles.description: Watch Barnsley's John McAtee score his second goal against Horsham in their FA Cup first round replay.
articles.title: 'The finish is exquisite' - McAtee's delightful lob for Barnsley

articles.description: The Liverpool footballer cried as he hugged his father who was held by Colombian ELN rebels for 12 days.
articles.title: Footballer Luis Díaz reunited with father after kidnapping

articles.description: A scathing independent report finds aspects of the Welsh Rugby Union were sexist, misogynistic, racist and homophobic, with elements of bullying.
articles.title: WRU 'truly sorry' after damning independent review

articles.description: Four-time winner Ronnie O'Sullivan says he will not defend his Champion of Champions title after withdrawing to look after his "mental health".
articles.title: O'Sullivan 'mental health' concerns prompt withdrawal

articles.description: Jannik Sinner claims his first ever victory against Novak Djokovic as the Italian beats the world number one at the ATP Finals in Turin.
articles.title: Sinner beats Djokovic in thrilling ATP Finals match
